title: Epitoin 120ML Susp
details: It is used to treat or prevent seizures
precautions: Use caution in cardiovascular disease, hypoalbuminemia, hepatic impairment, hypothyroidism, or seizures; because fraction of unbound phenytoin is increased in patients with renal or hepatic disease, or in those with hypoalbuminemia, the monitoring of phenytoin serum levels should be based on the unbound fraction in those patients. title: Lerace 250MG Tab 1x10 (L)
details: Lerace tablet is used to treat seizures. As it is used with other medications to treat the illness, which is called seizures (epilepsy).The tablet belongs to a class of drug known as anticonvulsants. However, the ingredient which is used in this tab READ MORE
precautions: Before using the tablet, it is very important to consult a doctor first and share the medical history with it or the current health situation such as pregnancy or any diseases from which they are suffering.The patients who are hypersensitive to this drug should be careful or should not use it, as it may cause a serious allergic problem because of the inactive ingredient in it.Before using this tablet, it is important to consult a doctor if the patient is having diseases like kidney illness (or is on dialysis treatment), having depression or mental/mood disorders.Avoid using a machine or drive a car, as it may be risky. This medicine can cause dizziness and drowsiness. The patient should be careful.The elderly or the old ones should also be cautioned while using it as this medicine can cause dizziness; they might have chances to fall or faint.Stop taking the tablet if the patients consume alcoholic beverages daily.In pregnancy Pregnant women should consult a doctor first before using it so that it may not harm the baby. The tablet is supposed to be effective in pregnancy as it controls seizures.Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of Dialysis treatment, Depression. During pregnancy, this medication should be used only when clearly needed.

precautions: Suicidal Thoughts And Behavior. Lacosamide May Cause Suicidal Thoughts Or Actions In A Very Small Number Of People, About 1 In 500. Call A Healthcare Provider Right Away If You Have Any Of These Symptoms, Especially If They Are New, Worse, Or Worry You.
effects: Dizziness, Drowsiness, Blurred/Double Vision, Nausea, Vomiting, Tiredness, Loss Of Balance, Difficulty Walking, Shakiness (Tremor), Or Memory Problems May Occur. These Side Effects Are More Common When You First Start Taking The Drug And Usually Lessen As Your Body Adjusts To The Medication.

title: Lumark 250MG Tab 3x10 (L)
details:
Lumark tablet is also known by its generic name, levetiracetam, as Lumark tablet composition consists of levetiracetam. It is marketed by Searle Pakistan Ltd. Lumark tablet belongs to the category of medicines that act as an anti-epileptic agent

READ MORE
precautions: Lumark tablet precautions that should be followed while taking it are described below.Before taking the Lumark tablet, you should inform the doctorIf you are following any other prescription at the same time.If you are taking any supplements.If you have a hypersensitivity problem from the Lumark tablet.About your medical conditions in detail and inform in detail about your medical history.Avoid increasing the amount of dosage without consulting your doctor. Also, do not suddenly stop taking this medicine unless our doctor recommends you.Consult your doctor before taking the Lumark tablet in pregnancy. Nursing mothers also consult with the doctor before taking.Lumark tablet includes some inactive ingredients.so, if you have an allergic problem, you should be aware of this medical condition before taking it. Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of Dialysis treatment, Depression. During pregnancy, this medication should be used only when clearly needed.
effects: Some of the Lumark tablet side effects are described below.The common side effects caused by the Lumark tablet are dizziness, drowsiness, tiredness, and weakness. It can also cause the pain or contraction of muscles that may be a reason for the difficulty in walking and controlling. It can also affect the mental conditions that may lead to mood swings, irritability, aggression, agitation, anger, and anxiety.You may also experience the symptoms of infections, such as sore throat, cough, chills, fever, and symptoms of anemia.It can also affect the heartbeat, such as irregular or fast heartbeat is reported.It can also cause bleeding, pale skin, and weakness. The overdosage can cause serious side effects such as coma, anxiety, sleepiness, ineffective breathing, and less self-control.Drowsiness, dizziness, unusual tiredness, or weakness may occur.

title: Epigran 5ML Inj 1x10 (L)
details:
Epigran injection is used for the treatment of epilepsy or seizures. It belongs to the category of medicine known as anticonvulsants. It is also known as an anti-epileptic medicine. It works by controlling the electrical activity inside the brain

READ MORE
precautions: Following precautions needs to be taken while taking this medication.First of all, inform the doctor about your complete medical history in detail.Read the leaflet carefully and also check the list of ingredients. If you are allergic to any of the ingredients present in the medicine, seek medical assistance immediately.If you observe any allergic reaction from using this medication, immediately rush to the doctor.Pregnant women must not use this medication at any cost because it can damage the unborn child's nervous system. Breastfeeding mothers should also avoid using this medication because they can pass into the baby through breast milk in small amounts and may cause damage to the brain of the infant.Do not use the expired product.Keep the medication away from children’s reach. Do not recommend the product to others because it might not be safe for someone else’s condition. Advise them to visit the doctor instead of explaining the situation. Store it below 25o C.Use caution in cardiovascular disease, hypoalbuminemia, hepatic impairment, hypothyroidism, or seizures; because fraction of unbound phenytoin is increased in patients with renal or hepatic disease, or in those with hypoalbuminemia, the monitoring of phenytoin serum levels should be based on the unbound fraction in those patients. Decreased bone mineral density reported with chronic use. Drugs that may interact with this medicine include Cyclosporin, dopamine, erythromycin, itraconazole, lansoprazole.
effects: Likewise, this medicine also has some side effects with every other medication. Some of the side effects associated with the use of this medication are temporary, while others might be rare. The following lists contain some of the side effects of this medicine. If any of the following side-effects persists or worsens, seek medical assistance immediately.Yellowing of eyesIrritable Bowel Syndromes such as diarrhea or constipationNervousness or Confusion Dizziness or Drowsiness Low sex driveSkin rashesThe appearance of red marks on the skinHeadache or light-headednessInsomniaTrembling of hands and feetShortness of breathCardiac arrestRedness on the site of injectionBlood thickensIt can cause hepatic necrosis, ataxia, confusion, constipation, depression, dizziness, drowsiness, fatigue, hypertrichosis, mental status changes, myasthenia, nervousness, numbness, tremor, tremor of hands, vertigo, excitement, irritability, mood changes, and restlessness.
